docs.lead_paragraph: The rate of the most common operating-room procedure performed in the United States ranges from 7 percent of all births at one hospital to 70 percent at another, a study has found.

headline.seo: Rate of Caesarean Deliveries Varies Widely Across U.S.
headline.main: Caesarean Deliveries Vary Widely, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Caesarean Deliveries Vary Widely, Study Finds

docs.abstract: Study published in journal Health Affairs shows that rate of Caesarean deliveries varies drastically among hospitals across country, ranging from 7 percent of all births at  hospital with lowest share to 70 percent at hospital with highest.
docs.snippet: The rate of the most common operating-room procedure performed in the United States ranges from 7 percent of all births at one hospital to 70 percent at another, a study has found.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The infant had been delivered prematurely after his mother and father were killed in a car crash in Brooklyn.

headline.seo: Baby Whose Parents Were Killed in Crash Also Dies
headline.main: Calls to Charge Driver Grow After Couple’s Newborn Dies
headline.print_headline: Calls to Charge Driver Grow After Couple’s Newborn Dies

docs.abstract: Infant delivered prematurely after parents Raizy and Nathan Glauber were killed in hit-and-run car crash in Brooklyn dies; baby’s death strengthens calls in couple’s tight-knit Orthodox Jewish community in Williamsburg to bring serious criminal charges against driver Julio Acevedo; police say Acevedo was driving at an excessive speed, which can be the basis of criminal charges like manslaughter or homicide.
docs.snippet: The infant had been delivered prematurely after his mother and father were killed in a car crash in Brooklyn.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and JOSEPH BERGER

headline.main: Omega-3s May Lead to Healthier Babies

docs.abstract: Pregnant women who took daily supplements of DHA, a type of omega-3 fatty acid, had longer gestations, bigger babies and fewer early preterm births, according to a new clinical trial.
docs.snippet: Pregnant women who took daily supplements of DHA, a type of omega-3 fatty acid, had longer gestations, bigger babies and fewer early preterm births, according to a new clinical trial.

headline.main: Pregnant Without a Policy in Graduate School

docs.abstract: Do graduate schools, in medicine or anything else, support pregnant students, or leave them at the mercy of individual instructors?
docs.snippet: Do graduate schools, in medicine or anything else, support pregnant students, or leave them at the mercy of individual instructors?

docs.lead_paragraph: Early Sunday, doctors at Bellevue Hospital Center delivered a boy by Caesarean section after Raizy Glauber of Brooklyn was killed in a car crash.

headline.seo: Double Emergency: A Pregnant Woman Dying From Injury
headline.main: Double Crisis: A Pregnant Woman Is Dying
headline.print_headline: Double Crisis: A Pregnant Woman Is Dying

docs.abstract: Obstetricians who have faced similarly grim situation as the one facing doctors who hastily delivered son of Raizy Glauber after devastating early-morning car crash in Brooklyn recall difficulties making the split-second decisions required in performing an emergency Caesarean section.
docs.snippet: Early Sunday, doctors at Bellevue Hospital Center delivered a boy by Caesarean section after Raizy Glauber of Brooklyn was killed in a car crash.

docs.lead_paragraph: The baby, born in rural Mississippi, was treated aggressively with antiretroviral drugs starting around 30 hours after birth; if further study shows this treatment works, it will almost certainly be recommended globally.

headline.seo: Baby With H.I.V. Is Reported Cured
headline.main: In Medical First, a Baby With H.I.V. Is Deemed Cured
headline.print_headline: In Medical First, a Baby With H.I.V. Is Deemed Cured

docs.abstract: Doctors announce that baby born in rural Mississippi has been cured of HIV infection after being treated aggressively with antiretroviral drugs starting around 30 hours after birth, something that is not usually done;  startling development, if confirmed after further study, could change how infected newborns are treated and sharply reduce number of children living with virus that causes AIDS.
docs.snippet: The baby, born in rural Mississippi, was treated aggressively with antiretroviral drugs starting around 30 hours after birth; if further study shows this treatment works, it will almost certainly be recommended globally.

keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By ANDREW POLLACK and DONALD G. McNEIL Jr

docs.lead_paragraph: At 27, an infertility diagnosis put me on the fast track to parenthood.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by medical student Anna Jesus describes way in which diagnosis of possible infertility compelled her to become pregnant while she was attending medical school; reflects on the fact that prime childbearing years are also prime working years.
docs.snippet: At 27, an infertility diagnosis put me on the fast track to parenthood.

docs.snippet: A day in the life of armed America.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Franklin, an accomplished stage and film actress, was best known for playing Ann Romano, a divorced mother of two daughters, on television.

headline.seo: Bonnie Franklin, ‘One Day at a Time’ Actress, Dies at 69
headline.main: Bonnie Franklin, Steadfast Mom on ‘One Day at a Time,’ Dies at 69
headline.print_headline: Bonnie Franklin, ‘One Day at a Time’ Actress, Dies at 69

docs.abstract: Bonnie Franklin, actress famous for her role on television show One Day at a Time, dies at age 69.
docs.snippet: Ms. Franklin, an accomplished stage and film actress, was best known for playing Ann Romano, a divorced mother of two daughters, on television.

docs.abstract: Her first labor was uneventful. So why, a writer asks, “has it come to pass that I feel even more terrified by the idea of laboring with this second baby than I did with the first?”
docs.snippet: Her first labor was uneventful. So why, a writer asks, “has it come to pass that I feel even more terrified by the idea of laboring with this second baby than I did with the first?”
